text: Really good! We were taken back by the smaller food portions when it was delivered, but quickly put that behind us with the first bite! The quality food is much better than your typical chinese delivery places. The sesame chicken is legit. We are full and have plenty of leftovers. We will definitely order from them again.
I got the beef fried rice & I loved it . Great price on the food and friendly customer service .
I love their lunch and dinner specials. The best Chinese in the area and they deliver! I have had sweet and sour chicken, won ton soup and generals chicken on this visit! Mouth watering good!
Very good food & boba.  Food was well cooked and seasoned and the lady at the counter was very friendly.  I'll be back for sure
The lunch specials here are the best! $6.50 is a steal for the portions you get. Plus they give you orange chicken and a wonton as well. I like the lemon chicken and almond cookies. Great lunch spot.

Terrible, got delivery, order wrong, smallest egg rolls O have ever seen. Asked for no onions....mongolian and everything else filled with onions. Called to get order right, fought with us about what we ordered then found the order and decided to fix it...45 mins later...not very flavorful food...cheap though...thats was the compliment...we do give credit when meals are good...but cant even say one good thing....never again.

Tried several dishes in a take out order and none of them lived up to the standards set by other restaurants in town. The large portion sizes many other reviews refer to do not make it worth the money, when the flavor lacks. I've never been to a Asian restaurant that struggled to even execute making rice.

You've been warned.

We ordered Chun Fai and had it delivered. They were on time as promised and the food arrived hot. My egg drop soup was delicious as were the crab Rangoons. Unfortunately, the rest of the meal was not. The orange chicken was very over cooked and therefore, tasted rubbery and chewy, The Peking duck was salty and a bit dry and the steamed buns that came with it were tasteless and dense. I was overall quite disappointed with my meal and would not eat here again.

We ordered the combo appetizer and five different meals, all of which we split between our friends since we all wanted to try a little of everything. It was DELICIOUS. Everything was so yummy, and not overly salted like a lot of restaurant Chinese food. We ordered this to be delivered to our home through Yelp Eat 24, and am delighted with the customer service I received. I set the delivery time to an hour out so we would have time to get back to my place, and the restaurant called to make sure the delay was correct and did not want my food right away, and they arrived right on time. This is my new favorite Chinese place in town!
Their pad Thai is soooo good. I didn't even know this place existed until yesterday. They are a little out of my usual travel routes but I will definitely come back when I'm craving pad Thai.

1. No flavor. Nothing seasoned. At all.
Fried rice was rice with food die and the vegetables have to be prepackaged frozen because there is no flavor to those either. 
Sweet and sour chicken was greasy and soggy. Mongolian beef was ok at best but lacking flavor. Wonton soup...... Where to start...... Ok the broth was water, green onion, and nothing else. The wanton was nothing but ground pork..... No ginger no lemon grass no seasoning no nothing. It would have been great if there was some flavor. Egg roll had nothing but a piece of cabbage. 
Crab ragoons lets be honest you can't mess those up. Cream cheese and imitation crab fried in a wanton. Those were ok. The service was awesome and delivery was quick. Very important.

I am writing this review strictly as constructive criticism. If they work on the food and recipes and put some passion into the food and flavors of what they are serving they will do great. I hope they take this and change what ever is happening in the kitchen. If they do id like to try them again only because of the service.
Fast delivery and food was fresh with vegetables. Chicken chow mein was amazing and so was the sweet and sour chicken. Had left over for the next day and it was even good cold.
By far the best Chinese food in Las Vegas. Everything was fresh, the portions were huge and the prices were just right.

wow!!  nice new Chinese food place.
its very clean and has good choice of menu.
very friendly service. 

I ordered wonton soup and other dishes and everything came good and has lots flavor.
also they make their own woton stuffing!!!!!

My wife and I came across this place by chance.  It's close to our house and the food is great.  We ordered the family meal so we could sample multiple items.  It came with a shared portion of fried rice,  appetizers, soups and two entrees.  We got a chicken dish a beef dish and pork all were great..  They make there own dipping sauces which makes a big difference in taste.  Our waitress was very pleasant and friendly.  This will be our new Chinese food spot.

I was hungry for Asian cuisine so I decided to order delivery here. Like most reviews on here I would have to agree that the food is quite bland. I ordered the honey walnut shrimp, orange chicken and a side of crab rangoons. They tasted alright, although I've had better. However, the guy was really friendly and customer service is great.

Yum ! Wow so delicious ! There are tons of Chinese restaurants near my house and this one is fairly new and the BEST hands down! I had the orange chicken which was amazing, didn't taste overly sweet and saucy like most orange chicken,and it actually had real oranges in it. The chicken fried rice was also amazing, not greasy like some Ive had in the past. Simply amazing! Ohhhhh and the Mongolian beef, tender and flavorful ! I also had the egg drop soup, egg rolls, crab rangoons and sweet and sour chicken. All of which were amazing. My boyfriend has the hot sour soup and he didn't care for it but everything else was perfect. I will never order from any other Chinese food places around my house! This place takes the cake ! I will def order from here again!

I had a wonderful first experience with this restaurant last year but the food has definitely gone downhill. I read the recent bad reviews and should have thought twice before coming here for lunch. I had the orange chicken lunch special and it was bad....real bad. The breading came right off the chicken and got more pieces of large oranges than chicken. The only thing that is giving this place two stars instead of one was the lady at the cash register was friendly.

Bad food, the a orange chicken tasted like lemon chicken and the spicy Mongolian beef was burnt! I ordered from grubhub and it said 2 free egg rolls with $16 order and I ordered $24 worth of food they didn't send me my egg rolls... Crazy false advertising and bad customer service

The food here is amazing, and the service is very good with a friendly staff. The Won Ton Soup is made with a  light tasty clear broth. I chose the  soup with shrimp, won ton and perfectly prepared vegetables. The eggplant dish is delicious along with the shrimp snow peas. I used to go to China Town, but now that I have found this little gem I will be frequenting this place from now on. The kitchen is open and you can see the chef prepare the food. He took the time to wave to us as we were leaving and he clearly enjoys what he does, which comes through in the taste of his dishes. It's so hard to find quaint and good little places to eat in Las Vegas--this place is a must !

I was craving hot and sour soup a few days ago and I always pass this place on my way home cuz it's super close! I ordered take out of hot and sour soup, pad Thai shrimp and lunch special of beef and broccoli that comes with sweet and sour pork, fried rice, and your choice of egg rolls or crab ragoon. It was all so delicious and such a good price I had to come back again to dine in. 
My boyfriend and I had lunch here earlier today and we ordered pad Thai shrimp, Tom yum soup, and salt and pepper squid. I first got my Tom yum soup and the bowl is a good size enough to share for two and what really blew my mind was what was in it. Usually at any Thai restaurant if you order this kind of soup it comes with mushrooms and your choice of chicken or shrimp and price is either $11-$13. This soup had big mushrooms, big mussels, jumbo shrimp, and huge pieces of fish in it!! All for the price of $8! This was my favorite and the spice was right on. Pad Thai shrimp was once again delicious and the salt and pepper squid was also. 
Their portions are big, the prices are cheap, their service is amazing. I love this Chinese place.

We've been here twice, and had a total of 5 entrees (plus eggrolls). 

The restaurant itself is decent, modern, clean. Prices are reasonable. 

Food is bland. Horribly bland. 

Two okay dishes: 
1. Chicken with snow peas - bland but decent flavor
2. Cashew chicken - bland, nice (subtle) garlic flavor. NOT prepared properly - they just threw the cashews on top. 

Three horribly bad dishes that they should have paid us to eat:
1. Pad thai - creepy orange color, absolutely tasteless 
2. Orange chicken - this is basically a staple in American chinese restaurants, this should've been at least decent, right? The sauce was slimy and flavorless; the breading was mushy. 
3. Pineapple fried rice - they managed to make it kind of spicy - but again, somehow, absolutely no flavor. 

Egg rolls: if you like 'em with very little filling and super greasy, these are for you! :) 

Oh, and the second time, we were supposed to get egg rolls with our meals as part of a special . . . but they didn't actually bother to give them to us. Maybe they were trying to do us a favor? 

My boyfriend doesn't mind this place as much as I do - but he likes very simple, very bland food. If you're looking for that, it's probably fine; if you're looking for flavor, do NOT come here. 

p.s. they also charge for fortune cookies.

Great food for a cheap price with a big portion. Amazing customer service as well. Water cups were never empty and they even checked if I was okay, and due to me having a cold it was nice for the concern. Great place to go!

Went to Chun Fai for lunch today. We ordered lunch specials just to try the place out. We ordered Kung pao shrimp and general's chicken. Tasty food, good service, decent prices, clean restaurant. Looking forward to going back sometime for dinner and plan to try the xo udon noodles and mu shu shrimp.

I love their food. They have the best cashew chicken,  & the chicken wings were crisp, juicy and full of flavor. No sauce needed. Third time ordering food and have been thoroughly satisfied every time.
My go to Chinese food restaurant. They have cheap lunch specials and they do deliveries for a minimum order of $10!
The food is still ok but... when we opened our take out, there were napkins from another restaurant (they were branded). Not sure why or if they were USED napkins but this was so disturbing.
Terrible. Orange chicken was the worst orange chicken I've tasted. Pepper steak was disgusting. The rice was plain. The fried rice had nothing in it. Don't waist your time or money.

VERY FRIENDLY STAFF* 
The food is pretty good, this is my 3rd time here. Large menu Selection as well. They give you lots of food for the "lunch special" portion. Only advice is DO NOT order the "Orange chicken" the sauce they use is not good. I ordered the "General Chicken" the Chow Mein is tasty. If you are not happy with your order, just tell them and they will nicely fix your order. Their service shows that they always aim to please every customer.

Second time here. Had a not so good experience last time, so I decided to try again.  Big mistake.  
Started with eggdrop soup, very bland. Might as well been dishwater. 
Tried egg rolls, again,  tasted like they were fried in old oil. Gross.
Finally, orange chicken was rubbery and seemed like mostly breading. 
 Won't be eating here a 3rd time
I ordered takeout from this restaurant it was phenomenal I'm from New York and it's closest I've come to finding a good Chinese Resturant

first time trying this place out and it's one if the worst. For starters, I got the egg drop soup which tasted like sink water. I never knew a chinese restaurant can mess up one simple soup. The orange chicken was dried and flavorless. I own restaurants back in my state and WOW, this I can verify as disgusting food.

This was terrible. Been living in vegas since June and tried this for the second time and this was terrible . Portions were very small and food tasted horrible . I feel like bc it was delivered it was poor quality. The cost was high for very little. I will not be returning to this restaurant .

These three stars are solely based off of the experience which was very hospitable and time efficient. 
The food is salty probably from preservatives. 
Fried rice is no more than heated steamed rice with soy sauce. 
Egg drop soup taste like egg yolks in warm water.

I was in search of a new Chinese restaurant. I haven't been out for Chinese in months following a forced renovation of the place I frequented - don't ask you'll have nightmares for months.

So, I went to Chun Fai. The restaurant was very clean. The staff members were extremely friendly. In fact, they were so friendly and the customer service was so amazing that I actually put a tip in their jar before leaving with my to-go order. I mean, they separated the sauce from my chicken egg foo young so the egg foo young would stay crispy until I got home and gave me a ton of sauces, napkins, etc. I was super impressed!!

It is therefore with a heavy heart that I must say that I didn't love the food as much as I enjoyed the customer service experience. The food was very bland. I am pretty sure they don't own any spices. Then, it ran through me (this is where I leave details out that I know you don't want to hear) ... my stomach was still hurting the next day.

I am back to square one. I won't come here again. Two stars only because they are so nice. One star for the quality of the food.

Ordered from Chun Fai via Eat24 and it wasn't half bad takeout! 

One thing I was hunting for and took a while to find was the difference between the entree and combo platter... it seems like you get less portion of rice with the combo platter - but you won't have to pay extra for the fried rice. With the Entree you get your meat selection, rice (fried rice is $1.50 upcharge) and that's it. Soup starts at $1.50.

Now that I got that out... I ordered the Lemon Chicken and it was pretty tasty. The chicken was crispy and the lemon sauce was good though it was a little thicker than I'm used to. The fried rice was a little dry for me but after adding some soy sauce it wasn't so bad. 

I also ordered egg drop soup - which was pretty standard tasting. The cup portion was perfect for me. And I ordered some spring rolls which were small but tasty! The delivery arrived on time and the driver was super nice.

I will absolutely order from them again should I be nursing a hangover and have a taste for Chinese takeout!

I would give these place 0 stars if I had the choice. I don't understand all these positive comments, I wouldn't be suprised if the owners of the place wrote those! I have never had worse Chinese food in my life!!! It was the most disgusting, nauseating trash I have ever had. Fried rice was dry and had absolutely no taste. They gave me 5 pieces(TOTAL)  of chicken that was sooooo oily and disgusting I threw up. The orange chicken sauce was HERENDOUS!! It was a watered down orange juice! The chicken wings were oily and the meat tasted disgusting! I wouldn't recommend this place to a homeless person! Never ever ever will I go here again!! Nevermind they said ten minutes and it took 40 min! I would rather starve to death then ever eat at this place again!!!!
Love this place! You cannot beat their lunch specials... Large potions, friendly service and ALWAYS FRESH!
Food is salty. Fried rice is like a day old and taro boba has too little flavor.  Taste is bland as what other people who rated this place and I got a crab Rangoon with a pinch of filling.
Great fast service :) awesome food!! It's always hot and fresh. Fast delivery, and friendly staff.
Good food and fairly large portions, the service is very attentive to your needs and I would love to come back again
Good price for what it is.  It's not gourmet, but if you're looking for "cheap" Chinese and limited other asian cuisines, this is your place!

I LITERALLY live 3 blocks away so I come here quite often, on my way home I figured I'd stop for lunch. Every employee is different and I thought well maybe it their parents (it's usually younger people working) but no.. I overheard the man behind the counter tell another customer they're the new owners as of last week..
Not very personable.. Quickly rushed me to a table and came back soon after to take my order. 
There's about 8 people in back (kitchen area) talking, laughing, visiting very loudly. (not very professional) 
Didn't bring me a fork.. Or spoon, napkin or knife for that mater. 
Rice was burnt and the lunch portions seemed much smaller. 
I won't be back

We just moved to this side of town and we were looking for a very high quality place to eat where we felt confident that every aspect of the restaurant matched my high standards and Chun Fai not only met those standards, but surpassed them. The facility is clean, the service is top notch, and the food is superb. The Sesame Chicken is phenomenal and instantly became a favorite of their many options of delicious food. I am a very selective eater and I feel 100% comfortable eating any item offered knowing that it is made of clean, fresh, and  high grade ingredients. The service and attention to the needs of their customers is important to them as they are attentive to the customer needs without being intrusive which is a true assest in this industry. There are so many choices of of food items to choose from it is enjoyable to relax and eat a nice meal. I'm impressed and will continue to eat at Chun Fai and tell all my friends and family about them. I strongly recommend eating there

We just moved to Las Vegas and I was craving Chinese food and this is literally right around the corner so we went. They have great food. You need to try the Sizzling Rice Soup. We've been searching for a great Sizzling Rice Soup since we moved from New Mexico in 2000. It took two states and 15 years. Also they know us and treat us like family.
Had a misunderstanding with a delivery and they took care of it quickly and painlessly.  Thank you

I have come here for multiple occasions now: lunch, dinner, and just for a lychee boba, and it is freaking good. Every time I have either called ahead of time or just walked in, the owner is so nice. He welcomes you and asks you about your day no matter how busy it is. Since it is getting popular, it is usually very busy. He also tells you if the food is going to take a little longer than normal and if you would be okay with that. 

Their lunch specials are $5.95! It comes with alot of food, very big portions, and you will definitely be full afterwards. There is also a dinner combination plate for $9.95. I have tried the sesame chicken, XO noodles, and mongolian beef. All three choices were really good. Perfect amount of seasoning and sauce. It has never been too salty or overpowering. When you get the combination plates, it comes with fried rice and another type of chicken with red sauce. It is uberly good. You also get a crab rangoon and eggroll. The egg drop soup is also good! The lychee boba is VERY good as well. I thought it was so good that I bough four more to go for my friends haha They all thought it was really delicious and asked me where I had gotten it from. 

If youre in the area, I would definitely try to take a visit for some food. Come with an appetite though! I promise you will not be disappointed :D

Still waiting on an order I placed Monday at lunch (It is currently Wednesday afternoon) maybe they closed or went out of business. 

Placed order for delivery online, got a confirmation email. 2 hours later no delivery. Phone calls to store went unanswered.

Unfortunately, my fave Chinese place was closed, and after a lot of searching on Yelp and Google reviews, this looked pretty good. Let this be a lesson that sometimes reviews are flat out wrong, even though I generally have really good luck when I go with well reviewed places on Yelp. The appetizers were ok, although crab rangoon was overfried and too crunchy, soup was decent, but then got into the main dishes and was honestly a little grossed out. The chicken was chewy and filled with gristle, it made me think of the fake chicken they put in mcnuggets and other cheap fast food. It was inedible. That was pretty much the story with the other dishes I ordered too. Like another guy said on here, I really wanted to like it but just couldn't bring myself to do it. The best Chinese I've found in LV by far is Oasis Asian Kitchen on Buffalo between Spring Mtn & Flamingo. Food is always amazing, fresh, consistent. Normally I like to expand my tastes and variety is good if you want a broader palette, but with Chinese when you find something really good just stick with it for the most part. When they're closed I guess I'll be eating leftovers;-)
Hands down best 7$ meal in Las Vegas. Still trying everything on the menu but the plates are huge. No more fast food for me. And the staff are nice. Really glad I found this place

My boyfriend and I went here for lunch right after it opened. Their lunch special are such a good deal, so much food for about $6. I usually don't like Chinese food because it seems greasy and soggy but I got the beef, sweat & sour soup, and the sweat & sour chicken everything tastes fresh and delicious! Our server was so sweet, he checked up on us, refilled our drinks (without even asking) and even boxed up our food for us! Like I said you get so much food and I took home half of my meal which was basically a full meal! 

I can't wait to go back for lunch again soon!

We live around the corner and noticed this new place off of Ft. Apache and Sunset, its on the same corner of Dairy Queen and Subway. Also saw an ad in the local Red Plum and thought we would give this place a try.

The inside is VERY clean and we were greeted with great customer service upon entry. The menu is on the wall and you have many selections from chop suey, thai, or your traditional Chinese food. As well as BOBA! Although we came for dinner, they did have a combination plate for around $9-$10 which seemed like a huge amount of food. My boyfriend and I settled on two "half" dishes, 4 crab rangoon, and two sodas which was more than enough food for both of us. Total came to $19.00 and some change. 

What set this place apart was that the staff was very attentive. It was a younger, more lively bunch running this place, which is nice. They made sure we were happy with the food and the service. 

My only "compliant" is that the Crab Rangoon could have had more cheese/crab in it...but it was still yummy. 

We will be back to try to the $5.95 lunch.

Very clean, friendly staff and great food. My son likes those crunchy sticks that they serve with the soup so much that I asked for a to go bag for the small left over he had....Instead they gave us a huge bag filled with those crunchy sticks!! Thank you guys!

This was by FAR the worst Chinese food I've ever had. Everything was dry and flavorless. The Pad Thai was so gross I couldn't even finish it. They used pasta instead of rice noodles. I couldn't finish it cause I got nauseas. The rice was dry, the meat was dry, and other than way too much soy sauce it had no flavor at all. I really wish I would have read the reviews before I wasted 50 bucks.

Love the food from this place! Great food (no MSG) and great prices. They have a friendly crew also. I recommend this place for when you get the craving... their Orange Chicken and their Sesame Chicken are both amazing. Do recommend. :-)

My colleagues and I go here on our lunch break. There is never a long line to order and the main reason why im writing this is because the gentleman taking our orders recommended the Sesame chicken lunch special. They changed the sauce and let me tell you its the best sesame chicken i've tasted in a while! Two thumbs up, i mean it was the perfect crunch, not too saucy and not too dry, ut was really delicious!

Ridiculously large portions, reasonable pricing. Seafood fried rice is huge, bowl of wor won ton soup is packed with shrimp, chicken, and veggies. All pretty tasty for takeout, $18 total is more than enough for two.

Delivery is quick, phone service while ordering is polite. The fact that they don't have a website is a little frustrating as the only menu I can reference is the photos posted here. 

Highly recommend they join an online-ordering service- giving out my entire card number, name, billing address, and security code over the phone is potentially risky and not something I'm super comfortable with.

I have tried this place multiple times due to simple convenience, but it's not a place I would recommend to anyone. I've never gotten sick with their food, and it's always clean every time I have been in there, but it definitely lacks flavor. I haven't been able to find a good Chinese restaurant that uses ginger in their sauces since I've moved here, which leads to me making a lot of Chinese dishes at home. Chun Fai is no exception. I've tried their beef and broccoli, kung pao chicken, and Mongolian beef, and out of the three, the Mongolian beef had a teeny bit more flavor, but I was left disappointed every time. They also don't include very much meat with their food. Delivery is pretty quick, and you won't have to worry about the food making you sick, but it won't really satisfy a Chinese craving.

Big portions! Good prices! Polite employees! Prompt service!

I almost didn't order from this place as the last 2 reviews were low, but the following reviews after those were four and five star. This restaurant serves huge portions for $10. I told them that they didn't need to bring rice (we're Atkins-y) and they offered to put extra vegetables in the dishes which I thought was nice. They were here in about 35 minutes and brought us a free app w our dinner. Good!

Food is pretty standard Chinese food (although I do love their hot and sour soup), but their service is what I'm impressed with. I've ordered for delivery a couple times now and both times it came quickly and came hot. Won't be ordering Chinese food for delivery from another place anytime soon.

Ok this place use to be Pumi Chinese food and that place was the bomb and when they changes owners and name to this Chung Fai place I wanted to see if they were still good. 

I did and it wasn't. Yes the inside was remodeled and it looks different and not as dark but really it makes me so sad that Chinese people can't get Chinese food right. I ordered the lunch specials for myself and my wife and I get it you get what you pay for but there are places that you get a great deal and great food but not here. 

If you are from the SW part of Vegas and have been to Jackie Chan Chinese fast food on Durango and Blue Diamond, then this place seems exactly the same. From the menu to the food. 

The food:
The fried rice that came with the meal had absolutely no flavor just looked like colored rice.
The sweet and sour chicken tasted like jolly rancher flavor chicken. Sauce was all wrong!
The Kung Pao chicken and the Mongolian beef is the two dish my wife and I gets everywhere we go because we are always in search of good Kung Pao Chicken and Mongolian Beef and this place was a HUGE disappointment. Mongolian beef was done so weird it didn't look or taste anything like Mongolian beef and the Kung Pao Chicken...I would have gotten better Kung Pao from the freezer at a grocery store. The soup sucked the eggrolls... I freaking love eggrolls and then I had these now I HATE Eggrolls.

Ugh major fail will never come back. I'll spend my money else where the only reasons they are getting a one star is because the service person was so nice and the Honey Dew Boba was ok a little sweet but ok. But then again I'm not here for that I'm here for the food and the food was no good! Sorry but if you want good fast Chinese food keep driving.

The majority of Chinese restaurants in my proximity had bad reviews. I was starting to think that I'd never find a good Chinese restaurant to order from. I received a flyer for Chun Fai in my mail box so I decided to check them out online. I was pleasantly surprised to see good reviews so I called and placed my order. 

The girl on the phone was very friendly and polite, she told me delivery would be 45 minutes, and took my card info to run my card. 

Items ordered:

-Broccoli Beef ($8.75)
-Vegetable chow mein ($6.50)
-Crab rangoons (Free w/order)

My food was delivered in under 45 minutes and the delivery driver was really nice. There is a $2 fee for delivery, so my order came in at under $18 which wasn't bad at all. The broccoli beef came with a small order of white rice. Portions were big, it was enough to feed my two boys and myself, we still had leftovers for the next day. All the food was pretty good, I really enjoyed the chow mein, it had tons of veggies in it. The broccoli beef has carrots in it and the sauce it was in had a good flavor to it. The white rice was plain but did come with soy sauce. Two fortune cookies were included in my order. 

Overall, I was really pleased. Portions and price are great, employees are friendly, delivery is fast, food is good. I'll definitely continue ordering from Chun Fai whenever I want good Chinese food without having to drive.

The General Tso's Chicken was to die for! The fried rice taste like authentic fried rice and the Kung Pao Chicken was very tender but could've used more seasoning. I was impressed and will return soon. Definitely worth trying if you're hungry for Chinese food...their cross streets are Sahara and Decatur here in Vegas.

We got their flyer about a week ago and was skeptical to try because most Chinese fast food places aren't the greatest.  Well, I got off work late and was too tired to cook or drive out so decided to drop by and check this place out.  We walked in and was greeted right away. Nice!     First impression they got an A.  The place was very clean with simple modern decor. We sat down and the decided to eat in. The waiter was fast to get our drinks for us.  We ordered the crab Rangoon, hot & sour soup, beef string beans, pineapple fried rice, and salt & pepper pork chop. The food arrived fast and the portion was HUGE for the price. But the most amazing surprise was the taste.  Everything we ordered was very hot and fresh and VERY TASTY!  I am so glad we came here.  Most definitely will eat here again since it's only 7 mins from home.  They hav great friendly staff and fantastic tasting food!  Love it and will come back again.

Ordered on BiteSquad and BiteSquad said they were running about 20 minutes late.  They called again to remind me that Chun Fai was running late.  

Turns out they were running almost an hour late.  Ordered the Thai tea- it was already watered down due to the melted ice cubes. The stir fry vegetables were soaked and soggy in the very thick sauce, which I didn't realize that stir fry had sauce at all. We had shrimp in lobster sauce, which honestl, you can't go wrong with. 
We also ordered the whole roasted duck- which at $24 was nothing to rave about. I will never, ever order from this place again. It was $68 with tip and the duck was dry and over salted. The place didn't even give us extra napkins or ANY chopsticks, which we had requested.

This food was fresh, delicious, and delivered 30 minutes ahead of time. The owner delivered and was polite with change for $100! Gotta love that! The broccoli and shrimp was juicy and so fresh and can't wait to order from here again!

I love this place every time i order a take out it always on time when i pick it up. It has been the 5th time i ordered a takeout from them. Food is good and worth the price. I love their spicy pepper pork and combination chow mein.

I was visiting from out of town, and I was looking for a good Chinese restaurant to have lunch with my family. We were so amazed at the quality of food. Beautiful Cantonese-style dishes -- we had the salt and pepper shrimp and calamari, chicken wings, crab rangoon, fried rice, stir fried noodles. Everything was salted perfectly and tasted fresh. The texture of everything was just right. We had a great time sharing all of this delicious food family-style, and the wonderful service met us with genuine, friendly smiles and fun, casual conversation. It really felt like a family-style meal!

In my years of eating at Chinese restaurants, this has been one of my favorite experiences. I can't wait to return when I come back to Las Vegas.
I just had the best $6 lunch of my life. The Mongolian beef awesome! Please try this place out!

We used to go to China-a-Gogo. I can say that this place is way better. Food is VERY fresh. I put the order online and the lady called to ask what time I wanted to pick it up so it would be fresh. Better flavor then a lot of other Chinese food places in town. Their pricing is a little bit better too.
Delicious every time! Orange chicken and sweet and sour are our favorites.  Quick delivery.  It's our go to place.

The ONLY reason that this place gets 4-stars is because the wait times can be a little ridiculous. Amazingly tasty food. Almost walked out the first time I went due to waiting for so long after I had placed a take out order, but I am so happy I stayed. Just typing up this review is making my mouth water and my stomach grumble. The wait staff is friendly, the food is great, and the prices are right. Check this place out.

I've been here twice so far and both experiences have been really nice! So far I've had the lemon chicken with plain fried rice, and then the pork fried rice. Both dishes were tasty. The chicken for the lemon chicken reminded me of pork katsu or chicken fried steak, so that was interesting. The plain fried rice was really good considering it was only rice. The pork fried rice has nice sized pork bits and there are plenty. I appreciate the prices for the meals. Try their strawberry boba tea if you havent!!!! Highly recommend! Also, the lady that brings my food is so sweet!

I really wanted to like this place since it's literally next to where I live, but it was AWFUL.  We ordered potstickers as an appetizer.  They were small and tasted pretty bland.  Then we ordered a full order of Sesame Chicken and a half order of Beef and Broccoli.  First, the "Sesame Chicken" looked completely dull.  The sauce was absorbed into the breading which makes me wonder how long it was sitting somewhere.  The steamed rice side was uh, rice.  Next up, the Beef and Broccoli should be named the puffy shrimp flavored beef and broccoli/carrots.  Seriously, I'm doubting that was Beef at all, just awful.  The "Fried" rice that came with it was pretty much white rice with brown food coloring, so bad.  

Finally, my wife ordered the egg drop soup.  Nothing special whatsoever.  The only reason this place gets two stars vs one was the courteous delivery driver.  Do yourself a favor and drive up the road on Ft Apache to Mr Chopstix for a decent Chinese Meal.

Wonderful food for a good price. Good portions as well. Honestly the BEST Sweet and sour chicken I've ever had. Got the combination plate. Came with fried rice, soup (1of 3), sweet and sour chicken and choice of 1 of 12 entrees. Got the almond chicken and it was perfect. Also they deliver.
Really good food! I haven't ordered something I didn't like. Happy to have this place so close to work! Highly recommend!

So I went to this place just yesterday, and did so because it is in my neighborhood and I really try to patronize restaurants in my area.  At first when I walked in I was greeted immediately and my order was taken right away (take out). I orders two main dishes and 2 side dishes. After approximately 20 minutes of being there, a gentleman who was there with his wife got his food (late apparently) and sent it back because it was cold and his wife had already been served her plate.  At this time I notices two of the 3 of the 4 items I had ordered sitting on the counter (not even under a heat lamp), so I went over to ask staff what was going on with my order (25 minutes) into my wait by this time.  The woman told me she was waiting on one more dish. I asked her if items on counter was remainder of my order (just to verify), and she said yes.  I told her that these have been sitting on the counter for over 10 minutes and that I had already been waiting 25 minutes and that I did not want to eat cold food.  The woman became argumentative with me stating it had only been 20 minutes and that my food was still warm.  I told her not only is my food not being kept warm but now she is arguing with a customer.  I told her I wanted my money back and that I would never be back again.  As she was refunding my money, another gentleman whom was sitting in the restaurant with his wife and kids stated to me that they were still waiting on there food as well and it had been over 30 minutes and that they had even ordered appetizers.  At the end of the day, I will never go back to this place not because the food is not good ( I never got to try it) but because they have terrible customer service skills and lack significantly in the Interpersonal Communication Department.  I would have thought as a first time customer, they would have gone over and beyond to make the experience right by a very minimum offering me the food at a discount; a free drink; giving me the food with and apology;  something, anything would have been nice.  Heck even just an apology would have been nice.  But I got nothing.  So with that, they will get nothing from me ever.  And I promise to tell everyone I know not to go to this establishment.

This place sends food out quickly, the folks who work here are super nice. Food at times can be a little bland. If you're ever in a huge rush these guys absolutely kill it in time management. I'd go back again.
Visiting from out of town, was stuck at an Airbnb sick, and these guys delivered not only great food at a great price but super fast and under quoted amount of time!

This place is by far the best Chinese food delivery. If you want to have a sit down quality style Chinese food to be delivered to your home... This is the spot! No lie! Plus if you order over $32, you get a free full order of shrimp fried rice! Yea shrimp! A++++

Decent food at a decent price.
However, please tell whoever passes out your ads to please respect signs that specifically request NO ADS OR FLYERS posted next to the door.
Awesome food and location,  tried the chow fun and Mongolian beef, fresh and Dericious. .great lunch specials and service is top notch.yea budy!! Be back for more..

I can't comment on the service so this purely based off of the food. 

Firstly, let me say I love Asian food, all kinds. So when I venture and try somewhere new, to be disappointed is upsetting. 

We got the sweet and sour chicken, and Mongolian beef combo plate. Both I was completely not pleased with. The Mongolian beef had a weird taste to it that I can only attribute to poor quality meat, while the sweet and sour chicken taste as if it had been friend in month old oil. The "sweet and sour" sauce was thick and congealed with giant globs in it, though it was the best tasting part about the combo. 
The chow mein was probably my favorite part of the meal. Wasn't too happy about that either. Crab rangoons were tasty but such little filling and all dough. Was not pleased at all it was like biting in to fried dough that some cream cheese has accidentally fallen into. 

My boyfriend had gotten the honey walnut shrimp and when I had asked him how he felt about it he described it to me as blah, with too much sauce that tasted like mayonnaise. 

If you're in the area, and are looking for quick Chinese food, stick with Rice n Noodle, half the price way better and they also deliver.

I am completely obsessed with Korean fried honey glazed soy pork chops. I'm also hapoy to report that this little eatery makes excellent Chinese and American Chinese cuisine. When the cooks are yelling in Chinese, I get excited. The food is worth the trip. 

You guys have to come here. Seriously. The pork chops and honey walnut shrimp was great. Can't eat to eat here more often. The seating is open and there's delivery nearby! 

I'm so happy great Chinese food is FINALLY in our area.

This place is literally right next to our house. I ordered dinner here last night thru Eat24. It was so convenient and fast. 

However, I was informed later on when I picked up my order that if I order online, I am not eligible to get the (FREE) appetizers since there was no way I can tell them if I would like crab rangoons or spring rolls. They said if I called I can specify it. That was a bummer but I wish that would not always be the case. I'm thinking next time I would write that down at the "Special Instructions" section when checking out.

They were very nice about and said that if I am willing to wait they can still get give it to me. I declined and said that it was totally okay. I'll get my rangoons next time! The food was decent and the portions are generous. Definitely a good Chinese place.
It's hard to find good Chinese food with out driving all the way to china town. Great place to eat in or delivery in Rhodes Ranch Area.. Always get the duck it's yummy !!

The lunch special is an amazing deal. Place is super clean and workers are young and speak English. They even have some Thai food options and Boba!!!! $5.95 for soup, entre choice AND sweet and sour chicken on top of it all!

I called at 940 and asked if they were still delivering, she said yes and got my order. She was so nice over the phone that I was already impressed. She quoted 30-45 mins and here I am over an hour later and no food. They're closed now so no one's answering the phone. I'm hesitant to just make my own food now since I'm clearly starving and overdue for dinner. NOT happy! I knew I should've just ate at home and stuck with Rice N Noodle as my go to Chinese spot, ugh!

UPDATE:
Got the food 10 minutes after that and I am STILL not impressed. We wanted to like the food so much, but there was no flavor except the taste of oil and over fried food. I asked for spicy sesame and there was 0 spice. The chow mein was bland and the rangoons had barely nothing in them. The sweet n sour sauce was more of a soup with how watery it was. The rice was soft and cooked well, that's all and that's a given cause If you can't do white rice then what business do you have. Overall 0 stars. Never again. We'll definitely stick to Rice N Noodle.

Very reasonably priced food. Try the Combo plates you get so much with it for $9.75!  We spent over $20 so we decided for the free item Crab Rangoons was best.  Right down the street from the back gate of Rhodes Ranch where we live.  Loved the service. My orange chicken had slices of orange.  I'm so stuffed and lunch.

Chun Fai Chinese Factory was a bit disappointing. I don't eat Chinese food all like that but when I do I mean like everyone else I like good quality food. I went in with my mom this past weekend because she was craving some chicken fried rice. On a Saturday afternoon they weren't busy at ALL and when we walked in there was nobody at the front counter but saw the chef just standing in the kitchen. Finally this young teenage boy came to the front to take our order. No greeting, No smile just a very monotone "Can I take your order". Digressing on that, we continued to order the chicken fried rice and asked how long it would be. He was puzzled and responded with "10..15.. umm maybe 5-`10 minutes" HUH? How don't know an estimated timeframe when there isn't even nobody here? 

While we were waiting I was taking a look at the menu a bit more to see if there are any items that they offered that would interest me in coming back. I noticed that they offered lunch specials daily and thought it was interesting that nobody offered us to try out or even take a look at that section with knowing that it was our first visit. Something that is important for small business owners trying to make it in such a competitive food industry is to take care of your customers and treat them kind enough that they would want to return. People forget that it's the customers that keep the business running. From the looks of it they don't care and that's possibly why the last owner wanted out however that's not my business. 

On to the food.. the chicken fried rice was "just ok" definitely nothing to go out of your way for or hell even write home about. I was looking forward to having a local neighborhood Chinese spot but I'll stick to what I know and continue to eat at one that is less convenient to where I live. I don't see them staying open too much longer based off my experience and from the previous customers who have reviewed them.

We stopped in here for lunch this afternoon. Staff was helpful and friendly. Food was good and you get a lot for the price. We noted that they deliver and since we live close by we'll probably order from them in the future.

I've had Chinese food all over and was hoping to find a new restaurant that was good. This place is the WORST  Chinese food ever , it's as if they mixed up the recipes .. General Tso Chicken with brown gravy ?  Everything seemed to be in a fried dough ball. I will never go back to this place ever

The best Chinese food I've had in Vegas. The rice isn't too oily and has a "cleaner" taste to it that I like. Beef with Broccoli is my favorite. Egg drop soup is also very good. Definitely a place I've gone back to several times. 

Also, the place is kept very clean and they have very friendly service.

Wow the ladies who worked today around lunch are soo nice!! Because of them, I'll be coming back. I got the orange chicken combination plate with fried rice.. it was 8/10 it was a little too sweet for my taste but it was still great. My boyfriend loved it. I also got the boneless ribs (they slice it for you) those were good. Portions are huge and they have a great lunch special. Pineapple boba was so good. I can't wait to explore their menu.

I love the appetizers and the chow mein here! The crab ragoons are so bomb! It's so convientent for me because it is right next to my job! They even take the time to deliver it to me! Would very much recommend!
Best hot and sour soup in town!  Wor wonton great, too...very hearty.  Staff was friendly and the place was clean and bright

I chose this eatery because it was close to my job. I purchased the curry chicken on 09/27. They didn't say much and the customer service is all but non existent.

I was on limited time so didn't care to chat anyway. I was told that it was going to be fried rice as a side. I was so excited to eat, however, I was so disappointing when I tasted the curry. It was disgusting. It's consistency was like gelatin. The chicken tasted under-cooked. The curry barely had any curry flavor, but I couldn't even enjoy what it had because it was so slimy! The veggies were crisp but the sauce was so nasty I couldn't even pick out the vegetables. The fried rice was LITERALLY fried rice. No veggies, nothing! It was more like fried and burned rice. I barely ate anything, and threw the plate away! I would not recommend this place. After this plate of food that cost me nearly $10 I will not eat there again!

To be perfectly honest, I'd give this place 3.5 stars.  I've rounded up to 4 because the staff is friendly, the food comes out very quick, and portions are good.  

I have ordered from this place a few times now.  So far, this is the best Chinese place I've found on the SW side of Las Vegas.  Here is what I've tried so far:

String beans with chicken
Beef broccoli
Chicken with black bean sauce
Salt and pepper pork chops
Shrimp with lobster sauce
Beef chow fun (dry)
Beef tenderloin with black pepper sauce

For some reason, the salt and pepper pork chops were breaded and deep fried, not what I'm used to at all.  Once the chicken with black bean sauce was super soupy.  Other than this, I've always had good food from Chun Fai.  It is really close to all of the Chinese restaurants I ate at while growing up in Hawaii.  The food is not great, but it isn't bad either.  And it reminds me of home, so that is a plus.  If you haven't tried this place before, give it a try.  You won't be disappointed.

We have ordered from Chun Fai many times and we are usually very happy with the food.  Today we were not, the food was tasteless and almost like it was left out too long.  I picked up our order right at the time I said I would be by when I placed my order through Eat24.  What really bothered me today was that when I picked up my order I wanted to buy a drink, I usually dont include drinks on my order because I choose to drink water at home with my food but today I wanted a soft drink.  When I tried to pay for it with my debit card they wanted me to spend at least another $5 in order to use my debit card even though I had just spent $23 on my food order.  Plus its not ok to set minimums on debit/credit card purchases, just check with the credit card providers.  Its against their policies.  I think we will stop supporting this local business.

Good quality, nice portions, and quick and friendly service here. The location is so convenient for me and the delivery is on point when I'm feeling to lazy to drive a mile or so! Love the BBQ pork fried rice and the free items they give when you purchase more then certain increments of food.

This is our first time here. The service was quick and friendly. We had the pepper steak. Most dishes like this have over cooked peppers that get mushy and blend with the other flavors to create a homogenous mess. But not here! The peppers were perfectly cooked. They tasted very fresh and had the perfect bite to them. The beef was nicely cooked, and the sauce wasn't to saucy. A bit on the salty side, but that's how I like it. 

I will definitely come back. :)

I got a flyer on my door advertising this place with coupons. I placed a to go order and was treated great by the person on the phone.

Upon pickup, I saw that the place was small but really clean. They had the order ready and were very friendly at the counter.

The food is really good and very fresh tasting.

Prices are really reasonable for the amount of food. The portions are very generous. I was able to get 3 meals out of my dinner.

I would suggest giving it a try.

I haven't had good Chinese food since moving here almost four years ago.  I've tried many places that weren't even worth one star.  Since this place is right up the road from my new place, I decided to give it a try and I'm glad I did.  First of all, the service was sensational.  They were all kind and very polite and attentive.  And the place was spotless, which is a problem a lot of times with Chinese food restaurants.  I ordered the Shrimp Fried Rice and Pepper Beef.  Both were some of the best I've ever had.  The last few places I've ordered any kind of Fried Rice, it had veggies and onions cut very rough and very big and did not go well with the rice.  This place had the veggies cut perfectly and instead of onions, it had scallions, which was perfect.  And the pepper beef was perfect.  The beef was flavorful and tender and it had just the right amount and the right amount of peppers and onions in it.  And both were $15 and I have enough for at least one more meal, if not two.  I will definitely be a regular here.  It was so good.

Great website, I like that you can order online and customize! Food is good quality too. We live within the miles designated for delivery but they won't deliver so a drawback, otherwise we would order more often.

Overall, solid chinese food establishment!
Hands down my favorite delivery spot. They are always quick with orders and very friendly. The potions are very nice too!

Sorry
But it was horrible!!!
No flavor and orange chicken and sweet and sour was over cooked.
The pictures on Yelp looked great but the taste was far from it!

Always willing to make substitutions and accommodate. They have New York Cjow Mein! Fast, friendly, and they deliver! 
Our family go to Chinese food place.

Despite some of the other reviews, I really liked this place!  My mango boba drink was excellent, almost as if she took the fresh mango right off the tree and squeezed it just for me! The food tasted really good too!  Service was friendly and prompt!
Some of the worst Chinese food I've had. I ordered cashew nut chicken and beef chow mein. No flavor. Might as well been chewing nothing. Couldn't even eat more than a couple bites. Boo!

Used the Eat24 to order my lunch. Since I didn't want to leave work. Not bad for delivery the price is reasonable. The taste to me is just like a Chinese dollar restaurant. Got the moo goo gai pan lunch. Fried rice, sweat and sour meat, chicken with mixed veggies. Good for lunch. Nothing special. I would order here again.
Bland, unimpressed, disappointed. Ordered soups, fried rice, orange chicken and beef fat noodles.

This was a place we regularly went. Probably once a week. The change in ownership has really changed this place. Nothing is the same flavor as before. We went back one more time a few nights ago just to give it one more try. Nope bland taste. The dish was totally different than it was before down to the sauce not even being the same color as always ordered before. Wish the old owners owned it again.  They new us everytime we went in and even when we ordered delivery. Such a bummer it was so close to the house.

I ordered the Beef and Broccoli, and the sweet and sour pork ( lunch)  and the Thai Tea boba.

The sweet and sour pork was perfect, crispy with a great sauce. 
The beef and broccoli was not the best. The sauce needed more seasoning and the beef was soft, not chewy. ( weird) 

The lunch portions are perfect for $6, the delivery was on time and the delivery guy was SUPER nice! 

So I'll order here again, I just won't order the beef and broccoli.
( also, idk why but they automatically give you brown rice and didn't give me the option to choose white on the Eat 24 app) 
So request white rice just in case.

Ordered for birthday celebration. Disappointed. Egg foo young tasteless, Peking duck mostly steamed buns and no plum sauce, veggies Ok, salt and pepper squid - lots of plain cabbage, walnut honey shrimp - good, just not much of it, Lots of steamed rice. Does not begin to be as good as what we are used to in Fountain Valley, Ca.

Ordered family dinner. Wonton soup, pork fried rice, orange chicken and chicken chow main. Side order of beef and broccoli and beef with tofu. Also received a free chicken fried rice because my order was over $32. Out of all the Chinese restaurants in our area this was by far the best one. The portion sizes were oversized. Nothing was skipped in flavor. Delivery was 30 minutes. Estimated time was 35-45 minutes. Delivery driver was friendly and didn't get pushy for a tip like other Chinese food delivery drivers. Ended up tipping him tons of quarters cause I didn't have cash. He appeared to be grateful, so I appreciated that. They did however charge $1.00 for delivery on my tablet,  but after the service and delicious food I could care less about a dollar. Looking forward to trying their different menu items in the future.
Food is awesome! I strongly suggest this place if you are looking for a tasty dish!! I frequently get delivery and they are always on time!

Great take out for a reasonable price.  Great customer service, prices are reasonable and food is made when you order it.  Only thing I would have to complain about is that my egg roll tasted like old oil.  Hopefully it's not a regular oversight but I'm sure I'll be back for more.

I drive by this place all the time and always see many cars parked in the front.  I checked the yelp reviews and saw this place has 4.5 stars.  I don't usually eat "North American" Chinese food but decided to give this place a try.  I was very impressed with the front end staff who took my payment for the lunch special and beef fried rice that I ordered.  He made sure that I got what I ordered by showing me the food.  I asked for less oil in the fried rice and it was perfect.  He even took the time to package up my curry chicken so it wouldn't leak into the carry out bag. Customer service is top notch here.  The food isn't bad either.  They don't use MSG here, so the fried rice was lacking in flavour.  But not a problem, I just added a little salt and it's good.  The chicken in the curry was very tender and the sweet & sour chicken was also very tender and quite chunky with not too much batter.  They are very generous with their portions so I will definitely be back to try some other items. You can't go wrong with their lunch specials for only $5.95, its a good deal!

I was not impressed...won't be coming back the prices are cheap and there is a reason for that.
Egg drop soup was not for me
Rice was no flavor 
Sweet and sour chicken had to much sweet and sour with literally 3 chickens lol 
Egg rolls wasn't impressed 
Oh and the fortune cookie was stale 

(Iv never left a bad review but honesty I felt it was necessary)

OMG! THIS PLACE IS WORTH MORE THAN 5 STARS! I remember coming here before it became Chun Fai. It was another Chinese restaurant owned by someone else. It was no where as good as the new owners and restaurant now are. This place is so amazing! From the genuine customer service to their to-die-for Spicy Fried Pork Chops  OMG! My husband and I "were" going to go to Outback, but this place was calling our name lol We live near Centennial and still made the drive! We HIGHLY recommend this great place to anyone looking into eating great Chinese food and served by fabulous people. THANK YOU FOR LUNCH AND DINNER TODAY!
This is my favorite takeout restaurant! Lunch specials are a steal. Tasty and cheap. Good service, fast, and good. Plus they have someone that speaks English.

So my order consisted of: spicy Mongolian Beef (half order) which was smaller than i thought since most of what was in the box was onions, a side of white rice- which i didn't need to order cause my meal came with it but the receptionist didn't say it did, and finally vegetable chow mein- the noddles were cooked nicely but the sauce made for the noodles tasted of waaay to much sesame oil. they arrived pretty fast and the food was standard so ill probably order again but definitely order different dishes.
Went for the 1st time last week. Absolutely delicious!! Large portions, and great food with a large menu to choose from. Will definitely be back

Loved this place, cooking style similar to east coast Chinese food. Larger menu than most places. Found out today they no longer deliver to our side of town. Too bad, they made a lot off of us when we entertained guests. The Singapore rice noodle (dry, not wet, as it should be) and egg foo young (liked how they prepared it compared to other places) are really good AND you can order a whole roasted duck to be delivered to your house. Without the bones. That's a big deal. It was my fave, I'm very sad.

First time dining here...my husband, daughter and myself. The service was so welcoming and doting it was like nothing I've ever seen before. VERY prompt and they even changed out our napkins 3 times during our meal to make sure we always had clean napkins. I saved the best for last...the food!!!  We had sesame chicken and cashew chicken with chow mien noodles...THE BEST cashew chicken I have ever had!!!  The food is packed with amazing flavor and absolutely no gristle in any of the meat. It's tender and practically melts in your mouth!!!  If I could give them 10 stars...I would!!!  I just wish this place wasn't the opposite side of town from my home!!
We enjoy the fresh ingredients and light breading. We feel like we are eating healthy, flavorful food

I ordered dinner tonight using Grub Hub. I really wanted a good hot and sour soup. 

The crab rangoons tasted ok but should have been crispier. 

The hot and sour soup really didn't have much flavor. I took a few sips and decided against the soup. 

I like the fact that there are half orders. The sesame chicken tasted ok but was bland. The steamed rice was good. 

I ordered a Coke. On the site it stated I was ordering a 24 oz drink. I got one 12 oz can. 

Though the food was edible, I wouldn't order here again.

I have ordered from here twice. The prices are standard. It's nice that they have small and large orders. Staff is friendly. My review is strictly about the food. Ordered sweet and sour chicken, beef lo mein, crab ran goons and won ton soup. 

Everything was bland very bland no real flavor. I do mean everything. There was 3 of us eating and we all said it at the same time. It was the same way last time I ordered.

I ordered orange chicken last night for delivery and I was so angry. 6 months ago I ordered the orange chicken and thought it was the best in town so juicy and great portion. What I got tonight was dry calamari type it was disgusting. They have gone WAAAAY down hill since they opened last summer. I did post a pic on yelp. Wish I could put it here also. Steer clear this place is baaaad
This place is not good the all! But the server he was nice! Just The food was really tasteless. No flavor! I'll never go again .......

Good quality Chinese near my house. The Kung Pao shrimp/Chicken tasted great and was not too salty which always a pleasant surprise. The hot and sour soup and veggie were tasty as well. Mongolian Beef was solid as well. Super fast delivery and good quality which is always in any food especially Chinese. Give them a try.

I went here during lunch and I think it was everything you pay for.

The service is quick, I think they get more takeout or delivery orders so when you sit in the restaurant it's pretty fast! And the food was okay, nothing extraordinary but not the worst Chinese food I've ever had. 

On the menu it says shrimp entrees are $6.95 but they're $7.95. Not the worst thing that has happened to me so I give it an average rating! Overall, recent experience.

My wife ordered through grub hub deluvered to my house PLEASE TAKE WARNING I would give this place a ZERO my rice tasted like days old. The orange chicken was like rubber and I found very little chicken it was so bad I got sick to my stomach and stopped eating Just looking at it   it looked like vomit. The egg roll tastes burnt and very old and had a weird Taste I had to spit it out. TERRIBLE TERRIBLE. MY STOMACH HURTS. Thank goodness I stopped eating this crap.

Nothing is freshly made everything is frozen cheapest food they can buy to serve you crap.

Came here on a whim the other day. It's close to home unlike our usual place. The chow mein and fried rice was great, but the wonton soup was a little bland. Their orange  chicken was fresh and you could tell that it was actual  chicken too, unlike Panda Express.  And the oranges were good and fresh too for the sauce they made, but it did leave a weird after taste.  We'll probably go back though.  I want to try their honey walnut shrimp.

The place is clean with very friendly and fast customer service. This being my first time there I asked questions about how things were prepared and what ingredients.  Every restaurant has a different chef with different cooking styles so I asked for customization and they happily obliged.

Did a stretch of a few days here for lunch while my love was admitted to Southern Hills across the street. Was drawn in by the bright colors and plentiful windows. As well as my obsession for Chinese food. 

Was greeted the second I walked in the first time and felt at home. The menu was lengthy as a typical Chinese restaurant. But the lunch combos drew me in. Entree, Crab Rangoon, fried rice, soup AND sweet and sour chicken. For 5.99??? What a great deal. 

The quality was also great. Ordered the Szechuan Chicken the first day and was completely satisfied. Amazing portion and tons of veggies that really round out the meal. Have been back several times since and will continue to do so. Also has a great dinner combo which includes all of the above as well as an egg roll for 9.99. Great option for that Chinese takeout craving.

I was a little leery trying about trying them out because the restaurant it replaced was terrible.  I order Mongolian beef and eggrolls.  Not a fan of their eggrolls but the Mongolian beef was very good.  I will for sure order from here again and try some other dishes.

The neighborhood needed a decent Chinese restaurant & Chun Fai Chinese Eatery will be welcomed with open arms. We started with the Wor Wonton Soup. The portion was large with lots of goodies. We also had the Shrimp Chop Suey & Beef Chow Fun. Each were very tasty with a lot of meat. Plus if you live nearby they offer delivery. I see on the menu they have lunch specials, I'll be back to give them a try. This place is located across the street from Southern Hills Hospital.

If you want fast down and dirty Chinese food while watching some Friday night TV or catching up on the DVR. This is the place to indulge on when you are on a break from your diet. It's not fancy Chinese food at all but it's reliable and the quality is perfect for the corner delivery food.

Tonight was my first time here and I got the combination plate with Szechwan beef, it also came with chicken fried rice, sweet and sour chicken, crab rangoon, egg roll and wonton soup. I was surprised at the large portion I got of the beef and the flavor was amazing along with everything else that came with the plate. I believe I found my new favorite Chinese take out. I also got the mango boba drink and it was delicious! The staff was super nice on the phone and very friendly in person also, even came around the counter to hand me my take out and then open an held the for open for me. I will definitely be coming back and probably sooner than later.

really wanted to like this place more, but they need to raise the bar a bit.  nothing really bad, but nothing great either.
had lunch there twice in the last week.  the first trip my wife and I shared the app platter (2 s
2 egg rolls, 2 fried shrimps, 4 crab rangoon, and 4 pot stickers, $7.99) and the mu-shu pork ($7.25).  
the pot stickers were the best for the apps, rangoon was decent, shrimps and egg rolls ok.  it is a good sized portion.
the mu-shu would have been very good if not for the lack of pork; should have been at least double the amount they included.
fast forward to my solo trip for lunch today.  I wanted to try some of their Hawaiian food (says Chinese Hawaiian Fusion on the door).  I ordered the small Katsu ($6.50) which was supposed to come with white rice and mac salad.  they were OUT of mac salad!!! how is this possible?!?!?
I guess they have new owners.  I'll check the newer reviews before I go back.
I was thinking the food would be salty but it was actually very good and the delivery was fast. The calamari spicy was the way to go equal parts of not to salt and pepper.

The worst Chinese food. Salty, fatty chicken parts, gross after taste and terrible service. Holy Shit this place needs a inspection ASAP I think they are breaking a bunch food laws. Saw a guy smoking a cigarette then go right in and cook at the wok. Barf!!!! I asked the Mgr Nancy and she gave me attitude. This place sucks. It doesn't even deserve the 1 star. My chicken fried rice was burnt and there was no chicken so when I called to let them know, the lady gave me attitude as if it was my fault, she then called me back to argue with me!!!! This is place is perfect if you want to have high blood pressure. Salty, disgusting food. Waste of time, money and total bullshit management, BARF

Absolutely ridiculous and disrespectful customer service here. I have been coming to Chun Fai for over a year now and the quality of food has steadily decreased. Five minutes ago, I called to inform them that one of my to go orders, the XO Udon, was inedible as it was half undercooked and raw noodles. I don't need anything free or extra, that wasn't the purpose of the phone call. The rude hostess lady proceeded to say that I was wrong it isn't yummy because they sell over 10 a day and no one has ever called to complain and what should they do about it even though I'm wrong. Seriously? Just no. I highly recommend that you go elsewhere for anyone looking for quick Chinese food. It's a waste of money and honestly, the worst guest interaction ever.

I'll give 3 stars because delivery was quick. The food was just so bland, no flavor. I was kinda bummed out. My husband and I love yellow curry some what spicy so I clicked 3 out of 5 levels of spicy levels and it wasn't at all spicy. Our rice was kinda hard. Orange chicken is ok . Maybe just a bad night . I'll give them another chance maybe.

Excellent little hole in the wall Chinese spot on the south west side of town. This place is full of flavor. Pepper beef is mouth watering tasty. The wor wonton soup is amazing! And the chicken fried rice is pretty great. 

I thoroughly enjoyed this place. The prices are fair and average.
I love the boba! I've tried pretty much all of them, but I definitely favor the strawberry one.

I order from them all the time. Their staff are super nice and friendly. Although the owner gave me the "where's my tip" look before when I ordered to-go (which was kind of creepy.)

Last time I ordered to-go, I opened my bag and guess what I found? Some cheesecake factory napkins.. hahaha! I thought it was funny.

Tonight, I ordered to-go again. And like before, I got their "repurposed" napkins (this time from sugar factory.) But what really threw me off was the bag they used -- a garbage bag. Hahahahaha!

I'm sorry. It was funny, but it was also really weird and I felt ghetto walking out of a Chinese restaurant with food inside a garbage bag and a bunch of sugar factory napkins. (I attached photos)

Minus 1 star for that.

Everything else was great!!
Great food!
Friendly staff!
Ample serving!
Great restaurant!

Got take out a few more times and had mixed results. Hot and sour soup is not consistent (sometimes way too sour other times not sour at all and has been lacking ingredients-- mostly broth). Entrees have been hit or miss I usually get kung pao chicken and try something new. Kung pao has been very bland a few times. 

Overall it's still close and cheap, just wish quality was consistent and good like the first time we went.

"I like Chinese fooooood........the waiters never are ruuuuuude"

Not always the case, but they were friendly here. It's really more 3.5 stars. From the outside, it looks like one of those steam table fast food Chinese takeout places, while in reality, they make the orders fresh. I got a combo plate with the general chicken. My entire meal was enjoyable, but I'm not sure if I would make this a "go-to" restaurant.

One of my go-to places for lunch. Great taste and generous portion sizes with an unbeatable lunch deal. Have received wonderful customer service each time I've gone and their boba tea is heaven. I like my boba tea slushy. None of this liquid with ice nonsense. One caveat. The convenience of ordering online is a bit dangerous. Wakeup, order, get dressed, pick up, eat. Oh boy.

The new owners at this restaurant have ruined this place. I started coming to this restaurant the day that it opened the old owners were fabulous friendly personable the food was awesome the best Chinese food in town in my opinion. Several different occasions there were other patrons in there saying how they come from all the way across town to have food there as well. I wasn't aware of the change in ownership and I ordered lunch our usual order, I could tell with the first bite that there was something really off. It is now some of the worst Chinese food I've ever had it's really a shame because it was so awesome before.

FROM DELIVERY 
Ordered lychee boba, Mongolian beef and sweet and sour chicken, a side of chow mein, and the honey walnut shrimp. 
Food came relatively quickly but the shrimp wasn't very hot and neither was the crab Rangoon that came free with the preset over $20. The honey walnut shrimp had a ton of sauce on it that was almost mayonnaise like. The sweet and sour chicken was whatever and so was the Mongolian beef. The lychee boba was the best part of the meal and the service was pretty good but I'll pass next time.

Found this place on Yelp and am so happy  we did. The staff is so nice and the food is affordable, fresh and scrumptious. We have ordered take out multiple times and met my hubby for lunch. Great place

We ordered delivery from this place last week through eat24 and delivery was supposed to take 45-60 minutes. After over an hour I had to call them to see if the food was still on its way. She stated that the delivery had already left their place and was en route. It took a total of 1 hour and 20 minutes for the food to get to us. Longest I've ever waited for delivery ever and we only live one mile away from this place! 

Then when we did get the food it was missing several items. Our soup was missing, our bottled waters were missing, no utensils, napkins or plates either, which I specifically requested. We just moved into a new house and had nothing to eat with. Just ridiculous. I tried running out to flag down the delivery driver but he was too busy looking at his phone to see me next to his car. 

I called them back immediately to ask about the missing items we ordered and they had someone come out to deliver them but again they forgot our chopsticks, plates and napkins. I ended up finding some utensils and using our own. The guy that delivered some of the missing items was apologetic though and said they were having a really busy night. I did appreciate the apology. 

The food in itself was okay. The orange chicken was soggy and lacked flavor. The moo goo gai pan had good flavor though. Lots of chicken and lots of fresh vegetables. 

Overall, the delivery experience pretty much ruined the meal. It made us run late for our other plans for the night and it was just beyond frustrating.

I love Chun Fai!!! This place is always my go to for take out/delivery. The food is soo good every time. I usually go for the Sesame Chicken, or the Kung Pao Chicken w/ noodles. The hospitality is amazing always. I really wish I knew the lady's name who delivers to my house. She is seriously the most sweet person! Overall just a great place!
Very satisfied with this store.  We ordered delivery and it was delivered promptly.  The food was fresh and delivious, the portions were generous as well.  We'll definitely be ordering again!

I ordered delivery from this restaurant and they delivered within 30 minutes of placing my order which is pretty fast compared to all the other places taking at least an hour to deliver food. The food was great and will order again very soon.

I don't know who these people giving high stars are but they have no taste buds because this food is flavorless... Which is very hard to do with Chinese food. Everything tastes LITERALLY watered down. Look at the sweet and sour sauce it's clearly cut with water.   I expect them to be out of business soon
Hospitality is off the chain here. I love it. Super nice and the food, dang, just look at the beautiful pictures  Will be returning frequently

The food was ok, not great. I ordered the Szechuan spicy chicken lunch special. It didn't taste too great but it tasted like what it says on the menu. My boyfriend's Mongolian Spicy beef didn't taste spicy and it was too salty. I would not go back. Another thing was the boba was weird after they made it. The slush separated from the boba, the slush was on top, middle was clear/cloudy sugar or water, and bottom was the boba. I asked one of the waiters if it was supposed to be like that because I never had a boba slush like that. He said yes because if I didn't drink it right away the slush would separate. I still thought it was weird and unsatisfying so the waiter just said let me take it off the bill. I mean he could of offered to say I will make a new one or offer a tea instead to do business but he didn't, it seems like he didn't know how to run a business. The other waiter was very nice and courteous.

First off i love how this place is right next to my house. I tried ordering on their website which didnt go thru i think it was just my fault i was confused on how to use. I ended up calling and placing my order. Its a cute small little place. I ordered 2 combination plates some shrimp chow mein and honey glazed pork chops. The only thing i didnt like was the fried rice and chow mein no flavor. 
i loved the honey glazed pork chops and the beef Szechwan. Oh and i forgot to mention i got a musabi (i thnk im spelling it right) but that was really good as well!

I dined in for lunch and it was so good! I got a lunch plate which was still lots of food! The wonton soup was good and the egg drop soup very hardy and good! It's the best sweet n sour chicken I've ever had! The place was extremely clean and I really liked the colors inside. The staff is very friendly. I will definitely eat there again!

This place is very delicious 
Service was great , fast and portioned really well.
Taste was explosive especially the spicy chicken fried rice defiantly recommend trying it . 
I think I found my new go to when I'm craving some Chinese eatery !! 
The crab Rangoon's weren't my favorite , but still decent & im a crab Rangoon fanatic 
Other than that I'd defiantly recommend this place.

This is one of those "best hole-in-the-wall" places you always hear about. 
The food has been outstanding all three times I've eaten here. The service is fast and courteous. Top notch all the way. 
I would recommend this place to anyone who wants good Chinese food.

This place is a hidden gem :) 
Was really craving DUCK and yelp had brought us here. It's close to where we live so I thought we would check it out. 


Food: ordered Crab rangoons, spicy Mongolian beef, and Peking duck. Crab rangoons came were delicious. I usually don't like my rangoons STUFFED with cream cheese, so this one had the right amount. You can taste the crab but it wasn't over powering. The Mongolian beef looked good on the yelp pictures, so that's why we decided to order it. It's not too spicy which was a relief for my twin who can't handle spicy all too well. The Peking Duck.. what we came for. YUM!!!! Boneless with a crispy layer of skin on top. Came with fluffy, tasty buns for you to put your duck in. I would DEFINITELY come back just for the duck! Yum....

Service: The service was perfect! They were attentive, always came to check on us to see if we were doing okay and if the food was to our liking (which it was haha). They were all friendly! At the end, they even boxed our food for us! 

Environment: good size Chinese restaurant! small but not too small! 

Etc: They have boba here! Need to try it out next time. Also, they have To-Go and Delivery!!!!

Okay, so it is not the best food someone can eat. But, I will say that this is BY FAR, the best Chinese delivery in the Rhodes Ranch area.
