I have ordered from many places nearby and none of them have the quality or the taste of food as Chun Fai. The prices are not outrageous and you can order online via Eat24. The delivery is super fast as well. I ordered and it said a standard 45 minutes, so I sat down to eat, around 20 minutes later my door bell rang. I did not expect it that fast. The food is very good and it is definitely a place I will order from in the future.

I am so confused that this place has an overall rating of 4 out of 5 stars! I ordered delivery last night and it was by far the WORST Chinese food I have ever eaten!  I got the Mongolian Beef, Sesame Chicken and Scallops with snow peas... I thought I would have leftovers for days but pretty much everything went straight in the trash.  I ordered everything as "spicy" and there was no spice at all.  Thats ok... but everything that actually had taste... tasted really bad. The scallops were the reason I tried this place... I usually order from China A Go Go... which is mediocre at best, but always satisfying.  They dont have scallops though so I thought I would try something new... sadly I spit out my first bite of scallops and threw everything away

If not even 1 of 3 dishes was edible you've got serious problems... I will never eat here again
Young girl taking order is very rude. Came here when they first opened and gave a good review but I definitely change my mind on this place! Won't be coming back here.

We normally goto China Ginger near trop and ft apache but they are now permanently closed.  I've been to this restaurant twice right when they first opened and it's been awhile since we've been back over here. So tonight we didn't have much of a choice.  Prices are good, nothing was missing. Food looked and tasted GREAT!  I would agree that it's maybe a little bland but to each their own and that's ok because at least they're not salty. I'm ok with adding my own hot mustard,chili sauce or soy sauce to my own food once I'm home.  So I have no complaints there.  Their soup however I do agree with others that it doesn't have a lot of chicken flavor and it's lacking in ingredients, it was mainly broth.  All in all I was VERY happy and loved the food and will come back.  

Oh and they were very friendly taking my order and showing me the order when it was ready.  

Thank You!
This isn't as good as previous reviews make them out to be.  Their fried orders: sweet and sour, salt and pepper, etc are often overcooked.

Surprisingly good orange and lemon chicken, maybe the best I've ever had! Also tried the shrimp fried rice (very tasty) and their tai tea boba! They have tons of flavors! Walking distance from my house and it's definitely worth checking out :)

I ordered for delivery. Both the lady on the phone and the young driver who came were very nice. I can't say anything bad about them. 

But that's where it ends. I ordered a bowl of war won ton soup, some rice, and some crispy noodles. 
I noticed they are one of the only places I know that still uses the thin, store-bought crispy noodles instead of frying up their own egg noodles. Not awesome. But okay. I'll deal. The rice was fine. It's hard to mess up steamed rice. But the soup. The only thing I would have hoped was good. The broth tasted like nothing. Bland. The chicken tastes the same. Then the pork and the shrimp. No matter what it was, it didn't taste any different from anything else in the soup. The wonton tasted like wet cardboard. None of it had taste (save for cardboard). It was some of the worst soup I've ever had. So unfortunately, though they were very nice... I won't be ordering from here or going here--because if they can't even make a good broth, I'm pretty sure the rest of their food isn't seasoned either. 

Sad. I was really hoping. 

Update: so I wasn't going to mention that at first, they forgot my can Sprite that I had to buy to make the order minimum. But now... So the driver came back. But not with the can I was told I would get--a styrofoam cup with lid and he said "the lid isn't tight so be careful." Uh. Ok. It said can on the receipt. But whatever. So I put it down. I go to pick it up. Not by the lid. But by the middle of the cup and the bottom of the cup breaks open and Sprite is all over my couch and floor. 
So not only did I not drink it. But now I get to clean it up when the entire reason for ordering soup was that I've had stomach issues the past few days and have felt nauseous and crappy. But now I get to bend over and scrub and then mop my floor. Yippee. What kind of absolute crap styrofoam cups do they use? And why didn't I get the can I was told I would get anyway?

The food was decent, I placed an order to go, a dinner menu and pork chops. took them 30 minutes to make my meal, the wait staff seems to forget what they are doing and my food was left out sitting ready for me to go for 10 minutes. The three customers who placed an order after me where all done and ready to leave before I got my food.

Overall i would go again only if i have placed an order to go 30 minutes in advance. Otherwise i would not bother to eat here.
Took an hour. Payed for extra vegetables FAIL. Another dish I paid for extra spice FAIL. ILL BE MAJING MY OWN FOR NOW ON.

Bland! The shrimp in the fried rice taste boiled. The spare ribs were ok.  I'm really disappointed that the rice has absolutely no taste.  I won't order from them again. I will give them a thumbs up on the food being hot, but the taste was lacking. I definitely should have read the bad reviews first.  If I hadn't of been in a hurry I would have taken this back.  The people giving the good reviews must like bland, tasteless food. 

The people working there were nice, but they need to invest in some seasoning and maybe a new cook.

Seriously some of the best chinese food i have ever had. That includes both take out and dine in. Food came quickly. Ordered the chicken with broccoli, kung pao beef and general chicken which was still crispy when delivered.

Not your typical Americanized Chinese food. Sure they have the usual broccoli beef & egg drop soup, but they also offer traditional Chinese dishes (Peking duck, salt pepper pork chops, black mushrooms). 

Today I tried the broccoli beef lunch special which came with egg drop soup, rice, sweet & sour chicken, and a fried wonton. Totally worth the $6. Totally happy that they are right down the street.

I love the food here but today i seen the cashier handle the register and then scoop white rice out of the steamer withoit ever was ever washing her hands. Hmmm makes u wonder, just saying. No one has a hair net in here.
Just ok. Been looking for a really good Chinese place in Vegas and I've decided none exist.
Food is delicious and the staff is always kind.  I've had several dishes and for the most part they have always been good.  My favorite is string beans, egg drop soup, and salt and pepper calamari.

Anyone who complains that the food is bland is expecting Panda Express. It's better than that because fresh! The food is good, the price is good and they served us really close to closing as well. I definitely recccomend.

Telephone order was easy and was quoted food would be ready in 10 min. The customer service here was wonderful, unfortunately.. the food had a strange taste.. specifically the orange chicken, almost tasted like there was a cleaning agent or chemical. The fried rice that came with the combo meals didn't have any meat or vegetables. Will never order again.
We ordered Chow Fun w/ gravy, shrimp and snow peas, and hot and sour soup.  Delivery was fast, food was good and the portions nice, actually the chow fun is huge.  Our new go to.

No bueno.  Have been looking at this chinese restaurant because it's closed to home but it had a lot of mixed reviews.   Finally ordered delivery and ordered 2 lunch specials.  It took almost a hour to get to our house, and the rice was just bland and the chicken tasted like the cheapest chicken, the orange chicken had a plastic after taste.  We took a few bites and threw it away. Both our stomachs weren't feeling that great after.   Should have trusted my gut feeling about this place.  Wasted money and time.

This place is the worst. Horrible food, even worse service. Deliveries are always late. Delivery people ask for more tip whether it's given in cash or prepaid. Had a bad experience the first time. Decided to give them another try. This was an awful idea. So done with this establishment.

For the area it's pretty good. The good... Great portions, reasonably priced and the General Tso's was pretty good if you ask me. Also, it's in a good location.  Cooked to order so it was fresh. Friendly service too!
The bad... Got the shrimp fried rice and it was kind of bland, some soy sauce fixed that right up. They told me it would be a 10 min wait and closer to 40 mins later it was in my hands. Overall, I'd go back.

I've ordered delivery from these folks 4 or 5 times now and they are always super fast and polite. There is one main delivery driver guy (kinda younger) who is always friendly and professional, seriously, he makes my day because he is just a nice guy. Thank you Chun Fai!
Good taste so so BUT SERVICE IS EXCELLENT!!! Here with the whole family for lunch special ordered Sesame Chicken, Mongolian Beef and Curry Chicken.
Terrible spot for Chinese food. Everything here is drenched in oil and submerged in sugary syrupy sauces.

I ordered Chow Mein shrimp lunch special which came with sweet and sour chicken and fried rice, Egg drop soup and Lychee boba. Their lunch specials are $5.95 It comes with a lot of food and very big portions. All food was pretty good. I had it delivered and it was here less than 45 mins and the driver was so friendly. I will def order from here again :)
I love this place!  The Sesame Chicken is to die for.  I have had both take out and eat in.  Staff is attentive and courteous in either circumstance.  Will be back often!!
Pretty impressed for just having decided to order delivery on a Monday night. Lots of food and very reasonably priced. Will definitely order from again.

My son ordered the shrimp fried rice and liked it. Hubby ordered the Singapore noodles and liked it. I ordered shrimp pad thai, but received chicken. I never mentioned it and just ate it because they used white meat. I REALLY wanted to like it because the service was so good, but it just didn't have any flavor. The waitress offered soup while we were waiting and that was yummy. I normally take any leftovers home, but didn't because it lacked flavor and we were going out of town the next day. The owner came and checked on why I didn't eat much! I will definitely go back and try something different. Maybe it was an oops?

I just ate at this restaurant for dinner. Pumi Express was here previously. The building has been redecorated and looks clean. The food was served very fast and tasted great. The two employees that I talked to were very friendly! I would recommend this place to others and will be eating here again.
Love it! $6 lunch can't beat that. Lunch plate includes sweet and sour chicken, soup, rice ahhhhhhhhhhhh sooooo good!!

Ordered take out: Orange chicken (amazing flavor!), steamed wontons, pork fried rice, spring rolls, mixed veggies (not cheap fillers of onion etc), and egg drop soup! Fast service, friendly, cute shop, decent prices! Highly recommend

I just ordered from this place this afternoon. I ordered the salt & pepper pork and chicken chow mein lunch special which came with sweet-and-sour chicken and fried rice. Also complimentary eggs rolls or rangoon with the order.

The entre portion was huge! I found that there was a lot more noodles than anything else but still tasted fine. The sweet-and-sour chicken had so much sauce that came with three pieces of fried chicken mix with bell peppers and onions. The fried rice was plain with no meat but I thought the standard fried rice came with at least veggies and/or eggs? The batter for the pork was extremely bready and thick compared to most Chinese restaurants. That said I don't know what to make of it. It tasted fine, but I think the batter was distracting in taste. Maybe I'm just used to all the other restaurants. I cannot say that this is the best Chinese food I've ever had, but it gets the job done.

All in all it was a good experience. I had it delivered and it was here in less than 45 minutes as they stated. Delivery fee of $2 plus extra $1 of over 2 miles. The man who took my order was also friendly. I would order again for it's convenience, service and inexpensive dining option.

I order Duck for us tonight and is horrible...we order Chinese all over the USA this it is the worst ever delivery so sorry you recommend this restaurant where Chinese delivery do not send sauce for the rice or for the egg rolls ????? 

I forget to mention the egg drop soup came without the noodles only one fortune cookie we are 2 

Shame on you  

the food it is for garbage

We were in the area and wanted to try somewhere new for dinner. Our choices were Chinese food, Subway and Dairy Queen. As much as I love Chinese food, it always seems to be hit or miss. But we decided to give them a try anyway. We were the only ones who dined in, but a lot of other people stopped in to order take out. 

Service was very friendly and attentive. Our server made a few good recommendations. I decided to go with the Combination Plate and chose Beef Broccoli as my entree. Kind of hard to screw up Beef Broccoli, but the beef was full of flavor and most of the broccoli was easy to eat. It also came with:
-Egg Drop Soup: good flavor. It wasn't too bland or too salty.
-Crab Rangoon: did not like because I hate onions.
-Egg Roll: average, but not horrible. I have definitely had better.
-Chicken Fried Rice: flavorful and not too oily. I appreciate that they made it without onions per my request. 
-Sweet and Sour Chicken: I was never really a fan of this, but liked it better than the crab rangoon.
The Combination Plate was $9.95, but I had enough leftovers for another meal since the portions were huge. I don't like boba, but I do like the drinks. I ordered the Strawberry slush without the boba. It wasn't the greatest, but that was expected since I already have my go to spot for boba drinks (without boba) LOL. My husband ordered the Combination Fried Rice. He said it was average - not amazing, but it definitely made him full. 

I think I would definitely come back to try other things on their menu for take out. Unlike Panda Express, the food is made to order. Customer service was great, the restaurant was clean and parking was not problem. Next time, to avoid getting something I don't care for, I will order a la carte!

The ladies upfront or so nice I told him I just wanted something simple and that I like shrimp so they suggested the honey walnut shrimp and I like chicken fried rice I got home I couldn't believe the portion was enough for 2 days was very good I will be back 
Thanks for a great di



Well went back and tried some  more food The price of the food is so reasonable 
Good good value and good food can't go wrong

This restaurant is fantastic! I've dined in about three times and every time has been pleasant. Twice I wanted something specific that wasn't on the menu and they made it for me without them giving me a hard time or complexity.  I order food from here at least once a month to go, the food is delicious and my order is always correct. I love that they deliver with such a small amount of a minimum purchase too! By far my favorite place to go for quick Chinese food!
Don't use the app to order!   Chun Fai cancelled their contract with the provider so they charge your credit card.  Only way to cancel is with your bank.
